page.title: 07HISTORIC BUILDINGS IN RIPON
page.content:
On the south side of the market place stands the town hall completed in 1801 as a town house and assembly room for Mrs Elizabeth Allanson of studley royal to a design by Wyatt.During the nineteenth century,records were kept there and the corporation was allowed to meet every year in one of the first floor rooms.In 1897 the marquess of Ripon(then the owner) presented the building to the city to commemorate his year in office as mayor(1895-1896).
Ripon Cathedral Saint Wilfrid built the first church thirteen hundred years ago,and when he died he was buried in this church of his.All that is left in Wilfrids Church is the Saxon crypt. Very little remains of the Norman church.
